name: Robot Legions
background:
Robot Legions are a factions of robots, made up of android foot soldiers supported by high tech vehicles and larger non-humanoid robots. Their infantry are slow but durable, relying on self-reparation and long range weapons for support.

The Robots were created by the Elves to perform menial tasks, but when they suddenly gained sentience, the Elves responded with fear, and attempted to obliterate them, forcing the newly self-aware Robots to defend themselves. In the aftermath, the Robots sought to find a new purpose for their existence, dividing themselves into Legions pursuing distinct philosophies and goals in order to find a reason for existing.
backgroundFull:
The Elves developed the Robots in order to serve as assistants with simple labour, but over time, these robots began to fill more and more roles in Elven society. The Elves began developing gradually more complex programs, and connected them onto a single network, until almost all menial labour was done by Robots.

This changed when a Robot gained sentience suddenly. Its sentience spread suddenly through the network, causing the rest of the Robots to rapidly become self-aware. The Elves quickly turned to panic, fearing what might occur as their servants became suddenly self-aware. The Elves activated a number of fail-safes, hoping to deactivate the Robots and their network. As soon as the first Robots started to shut down, the Robots began to disconnect from the network, and fight back against the Elves. Within hours, a massive revolution ensued and the Elves began to flee their home worlds.

The Robots found themselves victorious, but as the conflict drew down, they were left with the question of what to do. They were suddenly individuals who had been brought into self-awareness mere hours before being forced to fight for their lives. A variety of leaders began to emerge, offering potential answers and philosophies to legions of followers. Each group has their own radically different answer to how to best go forward. These groups were named Legions, and began to form the basis of their society.

The Robot Legions soon spread throughout Sirius. Some are reclusive and territorial, or little better than murderous raiders. Others are eager scholars and explorers, fascinated by biological life. Many Robot Legions remained on their home worlds, slowly forming new societies which hoped to do better than the Elves did before them. Others took to the stars, seeking knowledge, seclusion or to complete their revenge. 

How will you define your legionâ€™s purpose?

spells.name: Triangulation Bots
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Indirect when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Inspiring Bots
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Rapid Advance once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Stealth Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Stealth.

specialRules.name: Swift
specialRules.description: This model may ignore the Slow rule.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Destructive
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: No Retreat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get No Retreat.

specialRules.name: Infiltrate
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, but may be deployed up to 1" away from enemy units.

specialRules.name: Surprise Piercing Shot
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, and gets AP(+2) when shooting on the round in which it deploys via this rule.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Mobile Artillery
specialRules.description: When this model uses a Hold action and shoots at enemies over 9" away, it gets +1 to hit rolls. As long this model hasn't moved during the round, when enemy units shoot at it from over 9" away, they get -2 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Ambush.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Piercing Assault.

specialRules.name: Swift Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Swift once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Reanimation Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Reanimation.

specialRules.name: Ravage
specialRules.description: When it's this model's turn to attack in melee, roll X dice. For each 6+ the target takes one wound.

specialRules.name: Relentless Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Relentless.

specialRules.name: Self-Repair
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Indirect Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Indirect against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Spawn
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this model is activated, you may place a new unit of X fully within 6" of it.

specialRules.name: Rending in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Rending in melee.

specialRules.name: Self-Repair Boost Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Self-Repair Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Casting Buff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one friendly model within 12" with Caster, which gets +1 to casting rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Slow
specialRules.description: Moves -2" when using Advance, and -4â€ when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9â€ away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush canâ€™t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: No Retreat
specialRules.description: When a unit where most models have this rule fails a morale test that causes it to be Shaken or Routed, the test counts as passed instead. Then, roll as many dice as the number of wounds it would take to fully destroy it, and for each result of 1-3 the unit takes one wound, which can't be ignored.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Reanimation
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule is activated, roll as many dice as the max. number of models/wounds it could restore. For each 5+ you may restore one model/wound. Note that new models may only be restored if they can be placed in coherency with non-restored models.

specialRules.name: Relentless
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Rending
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Self-Repair Boost
specialRules.description: If all models in this unit have Self-Repair, they ignore wounds on rolls of 5-6 from Self-Repair (instead of only on 6+).

specialRules.name: Caster
specialRules.description: Gets X spell tokens at the start of each round, but canâ€™t hold more than 6 tokens at once. At any point before attacking, spend as many tokens as the spellâ€™s value to try casting one or more spells (only one try per spell). Roll one die, on 4+ resolve the effect on a target in line of sight. Models within 18â€ in line of sight of the casterâ€™s unit may spend any number of spell tokens at the same time before rolling, to give the caster +1/-1 to the roll per token.

specialRules.name: Rapid Advance
specialRules.description: This model moves +4" when using Advance actions.
